title: Great for people who cannot, for whatever reason(s) drink from regular, open-top  cups
review: My bedridden husband can still drink from cups, thanks to this special design! I got depressed one day, worrying that he suddenly needed tube-feedings. My husband of 21 years had suddenly stopped easily drinking liquids, and was also, not eating food! He has advanced stage Parkinson's Disease and Dementia now, and he no longer could hold cups, nor drink from them without contents spilling everywhere. I bought a food processor, only to see that he still wants REAL solid foods, not mush. Still working at ensuring he continues to get proper, solid- foods nutrition. But these cups now easily allow for him to drink his Ensure Plus, his water, even Pepsi, and whatever else he still craves! And there are two drinking options: the sippy-cup top that lets him drink through a sprout, or the flat-top-with-a-hole, that lets him drink from the cup through a straw inserted through that hole. I prefer the sippy nozzle top, but my husband's brother sometimes uses that straw-through-hole top, since I guess he thinks that makes my husband look more macho (smile)!

title: She has very bad arthritis throughout her body and holding hot cups is ...
review: I bought this for my mother to try to heat up water in the microwave to make her coffee or tea. She has very bad arthritis throughout her body and holding hot cups is difficult and dangerous but with the two handles she can hold it safely. The description said it is microwave safe but I would not do it with the lid on. She heats up her water for 2 minutes with no issues as far as warping or any type of damage. Also the lid with the spout helps her drink if she is in bed. I would highly recommend it for anyone that is bedridden or has problems with their hands.

title: Excellent producr
review: My mom with dementia had a stroke and was having a hard time with drinking from different kind of glasses and cups for her water, hot tea, etc.  I tried many kinds.  This two-handled mug did the trick for her!  It will take hot or cold fluids.  The big plus is that she can see how much is in the mug as she's lifting it to her lips so can anticipate how to swallow.  The bigger plus is that she can manage drinking now independently so she now has more dignity when eating: hurray!

title: Great Cup for Older Adults
review: We purchased this set of cups for my 87 year old mother-in-law. She has strength and balance issues along with essential tremors. These cups make it easy for her to drink from without spilling anything. The handles are easy to grab and hold. The base it wider than the cup making it easy to sit down as well.

title: Excellent solution for hand tremors.
review: This works very well for people with hand tremors or weakness in their hands. The cup can be held with one or two hands, gets pleasantly warm with hot coffee but not hot to the touch. The spout allows drinking without spilling, huge benefit with tremors. Lid is a tight seal. My mom loves it!

title: As described
review: I bought these for my mother in law who is in assisted living.  They are as described but she is unable to use them as they are not 100% spill proof.  Again, they are not listed as spill proof, I just didn't read.

title: Great for anyone with limited hand mobility
review: My grandma has arthritic hands that limit her mobility to grasp items. These mugs with handles help her to drink her beverages independently. She doesn‚Äôt drink anything warm, so I don‚Äôt know how they handle hot beverages. They do tend to crack after a year or two ( this is a reorder). We only handwash these mugs. My only complaint to improve these mugs is to make the lids easier to remove. With that said, these mugs with handles have changed my grandmother‚Äôs life tremendously.

title: Just what we needed.
review: These 8 oz. cups are great. They have the volume markings on the side of the cup, making thickening supplements much easier to calculate.  I like that the cups come with 2 different types of lids,  so we could choose the one appropriate for dad. I purchased one twin pack and was so satisfied that I came back and ordered another. These are exactly the same cups that the speech therapist used in rehab.

title: Just what he needed!
review: My 99 year old Dad has lost a lot of his fine motor skills, and I'd already switched him over to an adaptive plate and flatware when I found these cups. His immediate response was "where have you been hiding this?". I'm just sorry I didn't find them sooner! They're perfect for his needs.

title: Recommend
review: Very pleased with this product.My husband ha Alzheimer‚Äôs and it‚Äôs getting very hard for him to use a regular cup.These cups came quickly,and well packaged.For us, they‚Äôre working great, my husband can use one handle on good days and two handles on not so good days.A big plus is they do not look child like and give him the dignity he‚Äôll always have.

title: Easy to spill
review: It depends on why they are using these of course.  Don't expect them to last very long if they are dropped often.  They are hard plastic.  My elderly father would twirl them upside down and everything poured out.  They have no internal straw or spill resistant feature.  Good for those that regular cups slide out of their hands.

title: Didn‚Äôt work for us
review: I got these mugs for an elderly patient who often has trouble swallowing. She didn't like the sippy aspect. I didn‚Äôt like how hard it was to pry the lid off although I'm sure they need to be so tight to prevent leaks. Most elderly people would never be able to remove the lid themselves.

title: Needed this for my Mom and her room mate
review: These arrived quickly and they were well packed and in great shape. My Mom's room mate has MS and she's happy to use these, as it makes drinking something an independent job. Mom likes the cups as well. Thank you!

title: LOVE THE HOLE ON TOP FOR STRAWS USE & NO TIP OVERS!
review: I use them for a special needs adult who can drink from a straw. The hole on top makes it perfect for that use. It is tip proof with the wide base design! The lids fit very snug. Safe to clean on top rack of dishwasher. They hold 10 oz of cold or gently warmed liquids easily.

title: All Cons
review: Pros: none.Cons: drinks poured out of spout, closing ‚Äúair hole‚Äù had little effect; drinks poured out of air hole when cup was tipped; cups look cheaply madeI was EXTREMELY disappointed. Sending back, of course.

title: Almost life changing
review: My buddy has Parkinsons and is sometimes very shaky. Until I bought this cup visits were fraught with struggling with spills. Now he gets to drink all his drink and I don't have to do all that cleanup.

title: Helpful Cups
review: These cups are perfect for my elderly mother.  She has Alzheimer's and has lost strength in her hands.  After dropping a few glasses, we've found that these are much easier for her to handle.

title: Great for seniors
review: I ordered these for my 102 y/o Mother who has trouble using a glass.  The two handles make it easy for her to hold, it survived a crash on a hard floor and has a nice small spout to fit in her mouth.

title: Helps my dad be independent.
review: I purchased these for my father who recently had an accident which left him quadriplegic.  He is learning to use his hands and these help his ability to drink by himself. It never leaks and burns him with coffee like the others.

title: Just what we needed
review: The lids are very tight, and secure. I am sure they will loosen a bit, but I have to work the lids off a little at a time. Great help so far.

title: The product serves the purpose
review: It worked for an elderly person that was having difficulty holding a cup due to a stroke

title: Good quality good product but for dad with dementia
review: Purchase this for my 92-year-old dad with dementia very easy to use he can independently drink from it good product

title: Great for RA
review: Great product to maintain independence with  RA.

title: Broken lid
review: Cups seems like they will work well for the 93 year old we purchased them for. One of the cups came with a broken lid so we are sharing 1 lid for the 2 cups. This came in an envelope not a box so obviously at some point it was crushed or dropped I do not believe this is a product that should come in an envelope only

title: Good for someone with weak hands
review: I bought these 2 handled plastic cups for my mom who has carpal tunnel/ weak hands.She can lift these easily. I gave these cups a 4 because the lids are VERY hard for her to put on and take off.

title: Great product, easy to use/clean
review: My husband was almost completely paralyzed in his hands. He was able to get 3 fingers into the one handle and get it to his mouth to use the spout. It became essential to his independence after he lost his ability to use a straw. It did not require a strong sucking ability. He raved about these cups. Having 2 meant he could have an ice water nearby and his morning coffee.

title: Reduced spills
review: The double handles make it easier for mom to pickup and hold onto this cup. The easy on/off lid seals well, preventing spills. Durable. Clear makes it easier to see inside. Love these cups!

title: Leaks at Seam.
review: Product continues to not stand up in dishwasher even though dishwasher safe.Great concept but have had to replace to frequently due to cracks then leaking from bottom where center seal is set.  Have not found a cup that works better for what is needed.  Expensive for short term use.

title: Good product
review: Bought these for my grandma, her hands shake a lot. Sheld them with ease and they are lightweight. I might buy a couple more.

title: Great cups for intentional tremors
review: Because of intentional tremors, Dad needed a special, large grip, transparent coffee, etc cup & these cups are perfect!! He immediately loved them. Have not used the lids yet, but extremely pleased!!! Thank You!!!

title: Helps the disabled to feel more independent
review: Product is perfect for my husband‚Äôs disability.

title: Great cup for weak hands.
review: Cup is perfect for my mom who has very little use of her right hand and has weak fingers in her left hand.  The lid with the two small holes enabled her to drink sip her hot coffee comfortably rather than having to have lukewarm coffee from a straw.

title: Note Size
review: This product would probably be good for children with small hands.  Honestly I did not pay attention to the size of it when purchasing it, for my handicapped adult brother it is too small.  However, like I say, it may not be fair for me to leave a feedback as I myself failed to pay attention to its small size that other customers I am sure will find just perfect.

title: Great for my mom
review: Perfect for my Mom, who is in a memory care residence. I like that there is no design, as I didn't want my mom to feel self conscious.

title: COULDN'T DO WITHOUT IT!
review: Mom uses this cup to drink all her cold fluids.  She can easily see what is in it and lift it to drink with no problem.  She doesn't always use both hands but can easily lift it with one hand if it is not too full.  This purchase was to replace one that was cracked.  I purchased the two pack so I would always have a back up.  Thanks great product.  Delivered in a timely fashion.

title: Helpful for independence
review: Very nice solution

title: These are perfect for our needs
review: These are perfect for our needs.  My husband has Parkinsons Disease and they are perfect for him to drink liquids from.  So far he doesn't need the lids, but glad to have them if and when he does.

title: Wonderful!
review: I buy these for my 93 year old mother-in-law who loves them.  She can safely drink her morning coffee or cool beverages without worries of spilling.

title: Great cups!
review: Perfect for my disabled husband, he has a hard time reaching for drinks & spilling.

title: Easy to hold as I broke both arms & use daily.
review: I have 8 of these cups & use them everyday.

title: Grandma loves her two handled cup
review: Easy to clean/ use, Grandma likes the two handles so she can hold it steady on her own to drink water & Juice

title: Easy to use!
review: My mother has a frozen shoulder on one side and weakness in the other arm and was constantly spilling liquids on herself and others sitting with her. This cup has given her back the ability to drink without spilling and that has helped to boost her self esteem back up.

title: Satisfied
review: Helped my mother with deformed hands caused by arthritis. Quick shipping, dishwasher safe.

title: Functionality
review: The lids are very tight which has made it  difficult to open. Being that they were purchased for a person with a disability this has made it even more difficult. Other than that the product is great and it has served its purpose.

title: These "sippy cups " work great for my mom
review: These "sippy cups " work great for my mom. They do not leak, are safe in the dish washer and the microwave.

title: The product doing the job
review: Easy to handle. I do not like my reviews changed. The product is ok, but the seller doesn't need to add or change.

title: Great for anyone having a problem holding cup with one hand.
review: Light and secure to hold.

title: Good for anyone who has trouble holding their cup steady.
review: The two handles give added support and balance to the cup. My mother is in Alzheimer‚Äôs care and the nurses suggested I get this for her. It‚Äôs really helped limit spills.

title: Great cup, but eventually cracks
review: These cups work great for use with my Mom and have been approved by her speech therapist. The handle size is perfect. The disappointing issue is the fact that the cups will crack over time. I did not put any in the dishwasher this time and we still only made it about 2 and a half months before the cracks started. I then have to throw them away.

title: Amazing cups for Alzheimer‚Äôs patients
review: My late stage Alzheimers mother has enjoyed using these cups and they stopped her from being able to open up the cup to add unexpected things to her drinks.  Fantastic product!!

title: as advertised

title: The cup is lightweight Plus can see through it so you know have more or not
review: I was really surprised at the Quality and durableness so far and I also gave one as a gift to a friend I look forward to using it cuz it's lightweight easy to drink thank you very much

title: Three out of the four we purchased developed leaks in the bottom
review: I purchased 4 of them and within a month 3 of the 4 developed leaks in the bottom. Slow leaks from cracks. Making them worthless. It is too late to return them. They are easy to hold, and until three out of 4 developed leaks I was happy with them

title: Perfect for elderly people and for young children!
review: These mugs were purchased for my 93 year old mother who has difficulty gripping her drinking glasses that have no handles. They are very lightweight, and have large handles on both sides of the cup. One ot the covers has an opening for a straw. The other cover has more of a sippy snout.  She uses the other cup for rinsing her moth after brush brushing her teeth. Yes, she still has all her teeth!

title: handy little cup
review: I got these for the two handles that make them easier for my mother to hold steady. The built in sippy straw on the lid is a little too small which was disappointing, but I can put some pureed things in it without the lid (nothing hot or too much fluid) and she can hold it easily to eat out of it with a spoon, and can switch hands easily if needed.  Nice and lightweight and the small size is manageable.

title: Perfect for my disabled daughter
review: Bought these for my 5 year old with disabilities. After a small adjustment from tiny little kid sippy cups, she loves this. It comes with two different lid types, one with a spout but no spill control, and the other a sunken lid, like a travel coffee mug. The wide base makes it easier for her to set it down on multiple surfaces, such as the couch or her bed without it spilling. All in all, 10/10 would buy again.

title: My mom is loving these!
review: Finally, a cup my 95-year-old mom can drink from without dribbling (she only has a few teeth).  These cups are just wonderful.  Be careful not to heat the liquid too hot, not because of cup durability, but because an older person might want to drink it when it's too hot and potentially scald themselves.  The cups are very easy to use and clean.  I would highly recommend them!  We are hand-washing to avoid potential scuffing of the cups.

title: Helpful for stroke patient
review: My family member suffered a severe stroke that paralyzed the dominant side of his body.  If your loved one, like mine, cannot swallow without liquid going down the windpipe-- leading to pneumonia, etc.-- then this cup will help him/her to drink fluids independently.  The cup comes with two sipping options (holes/one bigger hole) and your loved one can choose the one that works.

title: Most helpful
review: I bought these cups for one of our Sisters who has parkinson's and has difficulty drinking from a cup.  I heard from a friend about these cup and decide to get them. They work perfectly and our Sister is very happy that she can hold them and drink for them with very little assistance.

title: Excellent teaching tool
review: This has been great teaching our adult mentally challenged son to drink by himself.  It cane used either with a straw or with the sippy cup top.  It appears to be almost indestructible as he has dropped it several times and hasn't broken yet.

title: They get the job done.
review: They are clear so you can see what remains and go through the dishwasher well, Lids a bit hard to take on and off ‚Äî guess that makes them leak free. I bought a second set for my husband because they always seemed to be in the dishwasher.

title: For Daddy üíú
review: My dad has Parkinson's Disease and these cups came in perfectly handy. They remind me of the children's sippy cups, he can handle all of his beverages without spills. It helps him so much, he doesn't feel like he's losing all of his independence. I liked them so much this was my 2nd order!

title: Don‚Äôt waste your money!
review: This product is useless. It is described as ‚Äúspill proof‚Äù. It definitely is NOT spill proof. It has a dipping spout which is great but it also has a hole for a straw (no straw included). Why would you need both? The drink pours out of the straw hole when the sipping spout is used. There‚Äôs no way to close it. This product is described as being for adults. That is the reason I purchased. It is useless for my disabled husband. Complete waste of my money!

title: WORKS EXACTLY AS DESCRIBED
review: I bought these to give one away as a joke for my friend's sixtieth birthday party...but I kept the other one for me! They seal tightly so be aware of that...a bit difficult to get the top off...don't push TOO hard. I like it for occasional use...keeps you from gulping air. I actually put Sangria in mine and it lets me sip on the wine without overdoing it...joking, but still TRUE.

title: Non-tipping cups
review: These are being used by someone with Parkinson's Disease.  He likes the two handles, the lightness,  and the wide base.  These cups seem to help someone who has a hand tremor.

title: great product
review: I am an occupational Therapist in a Nursing home and use this adaptive equipment to increase my clients independence with drinking fluids

title: Easy to handle for our disabled daughter
review: We bought this mug for our daughter, who is severely disabled and has trouble holding on to cutlery or drinking devices. This works great for her.

title: Best Mug!
review: These are the best little mugs!!! My mom has arthritic hands and these are PERFECT for her. Lightweight, easy to hold, small, but not too small...just right! I highly recommend. Would definitely purchase again. She loves them!

title: Good product
review: I bought these for my dad because he has swallowing problems and is at risk for aspiration. He is also left handed. It's has handles on both sides and he loves it.

title: Great Cups
review: These cups are good if you have an elderly parent with familial tremors. They allow one to drink without spilling the contents.

title: Great product!
review: Works well for my father-in-law. It does not leak. The handles are large, and he is able to pick it up easily.

title: Works
review: Very stable and easy to hold for advanced Parkinson‚Äôs patient. Lid is hard to get off when caregivers are filling, cleaning.

review: This is a purchase for my father who has visible tremors.  It is a very helpful item.

title: Great!
review: These cups work great for my father who has Parkinson's.  He can drink without spilling because his hands are shaky.  Thank you for a great product.

title: lightweight - easy to hold for old arthritic hands
review: My 96 year old mom is recovering from a fall.  When I saw the nursing home using sippy cups, I ordered them for her to use when she came home.  Zip from the blender into the cup, snap on the lid, and ready to drink!

review: High quality cup with a tight seal. For sipping, but straw can also be inserted in hole in top. Large handles. Easy to use and secure. A real bargain.

title: cups work like a charm
